name: Abyss Order
desc: An organization comprised of the cursed Khaenri'ahns and non-human monsters. They are the enemies of surface civilization and thrive in many corners of the world. Their main goal is to destroy the world under the rule of The Seven.

customize.name: Chlothar
customize.desc: A pure-blood Khaenri'ahn who was cursed with immortality by Celestia. He is a member of the Alberich Clan and the founder of the Abyss Order.

customize.text: A Khaenri'ahn nobleman who was cursed after the

customize.name: Khaenri'ahn cataclysm
customize.desc: A disaster that occurred 500 years ago. The Abyss was released into Teyvat and Khaenri'ah was destroyed.

customize.text:

Twin
Princess/Prince of the Abyss Order, who became the leader after Chlothar disappeared.

customize.name: Enjou
customize.desc: A member of the Abyss Order, who calls himself a bookish character and a scholar. He's also known as The Thing Calling Itself "Enjou," Sanka, and The Thing Calling Itself "Sanka."

customize.text: A clerk of the Abyss Order who is interested in the ancient civilization of

customize.name: Mare Jivari
customize.desc: A place at the westernmost part of Natlan, which was created during the Cataclysm 500 years ago. A Border Master, Sanhaj Kompore, summoned a miniature Night Kingdom and exploded it to defeat the encroaching dark calamity, thus creating the Mare Jivari.

Klingsor
A former member of the Order of Skeptics and the descendant of the Schwanenritter, Hadura. During the exploration of the old Khaenri'ahn ruins, he succumbed to the call of the Abyss.

customize.name: Vedrfolnir
customize.desc: One of the Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, also known as "The Visionary."

customize.text: One of the Khaenir'ahn Sinners, who awakened Chlothar Alberich's son. In admiration of his power, Chlothar promised to worship this "god" and later founded the Abyss Order.

customize.name: Loom of Fate
customize.desc: A device created by the Abyss Order that is capable of weaving Ley Lines. Using the Loom of Fate, the Atlas of the New World was created — reconstructed Ley Lines of New Khaenri'ah based on the memories of 500 years ago.

customize.text: The Abyss Order's project to design a mechanism that can weave the Ley Lines.

customize.name: Caribert
customize.desc: Chlothar Alberich's illegitimate son who became a hilichurl due to the Heavenly Principles' curse. He was used to create the Loom of Fate.

customize.text: The Abyss Order used Chlothar's dead son to create the Loom of Fate.

customize.name: Osial
customize.desc: Overlord of the Vortex, who was defeated by Rex Lapis during the Archon War.

customize.text: The Abyss Order wanted to create a new mechanical god from the Overlord of the Vortex. They would use "the Defiled Statue" as a base, attaching Osial's limbs to it, and the new core that shall replace the orb usually held by the Statue of The Seven would be the eye of the very first Field Tiller. This god was supposed to "topple the divine thrones of Celestia."

customize.name: Dvalin
customize.desc: An Elemental Dragon and the Anemo Archon Barbatos's friend. After being poisoned by the Shadow Dragon's blood, he became known as Stormterror.

customize.text: The Abyss Order manipulated the poisoned Dvalin to turn against the Anemo Archon and the Mondstadters, whom he had protected for centuries.

customize.name: Andrius
customize.desc: The Great Wolf King of the North, a protector of Wolvendom and one of the Four Winds.

customize.text: The Abyss Order promised to return the god's powers to the King of the North Wind if he would serve them.

customize.name: Iniquitous Baptist
customize.desc:
A monster from the Abyss that wields multiple types of Elemental Power and has gained extra limbs from its "evolution."

"The nature of the 'Abyss' is essentially irreconcilable with the elements. However, even the elements of gods can be entrapped and distorted before they are subsumed to become tools of the abyssal will. Just judging from outcomes and practical use, "Abyssal powers" seem little different from elemental items, from ones as paltry as the Treasure Hoarders' elemental containers to those as powerful as Visions..."
—Notes left behind in Hangeh Afrasiyab by someone.

customize.name: Abyss Herald: Wicked Torrents
customize.desc:
Servants of the Abyss Order that use Hydro in combat.
These silent figures are the vanguard of the Abyss, brandishing Tidal Blades that can engulf everything in an instant, crumpling armor and obliterating heretics. They shall bring preordained damnation upon the foolish masses.

customize.name: Abyss Herald: Frost Fall
customize.desc:
A monster from the Abyss Order that wields frigid, icy blades in battle.

Just as there are saints who will spread and glorify the profound gospel, there are envoys who must correct any twisted strains and remove any dissonance.

People often say that steel feels like ice as it pierces the body, but this dark frost is said to freeze even the soul.

customize.name: Abyss Lector: Fathomless Flames
customize.desc:
Wielders of abyssal fire who pursue the meaning behind texts and scriptures. Is a member of the Abyss Order.
The surface people have a slightly distorted understanding of what their name means, calling them "Lectors," when their name can also mean "exegete." Reading the word of grace grants them great power.

customize.name: Abyss Lector: Violet Lightning
customize.desc:
A monster who serves the Abyss Order and commands lightning while singing the praises of the darkness.
These are the evangelists and the scholars of the Abyss. Their violent lightning strikes the hearts of unbelievers with dark wisdom, warped by the shadowy depths of an eternal night, its violet glow proclaiming the existence of a great power that corrodes human intellect.

customize.name: Hydro Abyss Mage
customize.desc:
Abyss creatures that utilize Hydro energy in battle.
Stories circulate among adventurers that Abyss Mages are at the lowest rung of the Abyss Order's hierarchy and that they roam the various lands to scheme fell deeds of destruction. Though they also often make fun of these Abyss Mages, saying that the most harm they can do is to cause rheumatism or a common cold, their power is not to be underestimated.

customize.name: Cryo Abyss Mage
customize.desc:
Abyss creatures that call upon Cryo in battle.
Though they dabble with great power and can even create icicles by condensing and freezing water vapor in the atmosphere, their bodies are very vulnerable in and of themselves. Once their protective barrier has been broken, they are at your mercy.

customize.name: Pyro Abyss Mage
customize.desc:
Abyss creatures who command the power of Pyro in battle.
For unknown reasons, Abyss Mages are able to communicate with the hilichurls, thus enabling them to manipulate their minds easily. They say that Abyss Mages utter a long-forgotten language from which they draw magical power.

customize.name: Electro Abyss Mage
customize.desc:
Abyss creatures that utilize Electro in battles.
While studying at the Akademiya, researcher Alva Nikola once conducted a systematic study of the methods by which Electro Abyss Mages manipulate Electro and came up with a theoretical weapon known as the Nikola Coil. However, it has yet to be put into practice. Some say that his research materials were eaten during a fungal infestation.

customize.name: Letter from the Abyss Order
customize.desc: Seems to be a declaration of war from the Abyss Order to the "Darknight Hero." Many key phrases have been redacted.

imgDesc.text: After meeting with Vedrfolnir and the Abyss power, Chlothar Alberich founded the Abyss Order.
Stolen statue of the Anemo Archon. Instead of the orb, it holds the Abyssal energy in its hands.

The Abyss Order wanted to use the cleansing water in the fountain of the upside-down city in the Chasm to remove the curses of the gods and revive Khaenri'ah, but this brought only unbearable pain and agony.
